[File: src/common.rs] [Function: CheckPrivateShares::get_point()] [High - HashMap Access Panic] Direct HashMap access with '[]' operator can panic if poly key is missing - should this return an error?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: CheckPrivateShares::get_point()] [High - Vector Access Panic] Direct vector access 'poly[k]' can panic if k >= len - is bounds checking needed?
[File: src/common.rs] [All Functions] [Medium - Integer Overflow] Are all u32 arithmetic operations (multiplication, addition) checked for overflow, or can overflow cause unexpected behavior?

[File: src/common.rs] [Struct: Nonce Debug] [Low - Information Hiding] The Debug impl hides Nonce values with finish_non_exhaustive() - is this sufficient to prevent accidental logging of secret nonces?
[File: src/common.rs] [All Structs] [Medium - Clone Safety] Do all Clone implementations properly copy sensitive data, or can shallow copies create reference aliasing issues?
[File: src/common.rs] [Trait Implementations] [Medium - Trait Safety] Are trait implementations (Add, Mul, Zero, One) for Nonce/PublicNonce constant-time to prevent timing attacks?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: Nonce::is_valid()] [High - Boundary Values] Does is_valid() properly handle Scalar::MAX, Scalar::MAX-1, and other boundary scalar values?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: PublicNonce::is_valid()] [High - Curve Edge Cases] Does is_valid() check for points at infinity, points of low order, and other curve edge cases?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: validate_key_id()] [Medium - Maximum Values] If num_keys == u32::MAX, does 'key_id <= num_keys' allow key_id == u32::MAX, causing overflow in array indexing?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: validate_signer_id()] [Medium - Zero Signers] If num_signers == 0, does the validation reject all signer_ids correctly?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: check_public_shares()] [High - Maximum Threshold] If threshold == usize::MAX, can the polynomial length check overflow or behave unexpectedly?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: CheckPrivateShares::new()] [High - Empty Inputs] If shares or polys are empty HashMaps, does new() handle this gracefully or panic/produce undefined results?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: CheckPrivateShares::get_size()] [High - Size Overflow] If t * n overflows u32, does get_size() return an incorrect small value, breaking MultiMult?
[File: src/common.rs] [Struct: PolyCommitment] [Medium - Maximum Polynomial Degree] Can an attacker submit a PolyCommitment with poly.len() == usize::MAX, causing memory exhaustion?
[File: src/common.rs] [Struct: SignatureShare] [Medium - Maximum Key IDs] Can key_ids.len() == usize::MAX cause memory or computation DoS during aggregation?

[File: src/common.rs] [Function: Nonce::random()] [Critical - Cross-Round Nonce Reuse] If the same secret_key is used across multiple signing rounds with different messages, does the RFC 9591 generation ensure distinct nonces?

[File: src/common.rs] [Function: TupleProof::challenge()] [High - Domain Separation] Is the challenge computation sufficiently distinct from Signature::verify() challenge to prevent cross-protocol attacks?

[File: src/common.rs] [Function: check_public_shares()] [Critical - DKG Abort] If check_public_shares() returns false for some parties, does the protocol properly abort DKG, or can partial success lead to weak keys?

[File: src/common.rs] [Struct: SignatureShare] [Critical - Threshold Enforcement] Does SignatureShare validation ensure that aggregating fewer than threshold shares fails, or is this enforced elsewhere?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: Signature::verify()] [Critical - Group Key Binding] Does verify() ensure the signature is for the correct group public key, preventing signature transplant attacks?

[File: src/common.rs] [Struct: PolyCommitment] [High - Commitment Uniqueness] Does the protocol ensure each party submits exactly one PolyCommitment per DKG round, preventing multi-commitment attacks?

[File: src/common.rs] [Function: CheckPrivateShares] [Critical - Share Consistency] Does MultiMult verification ensure that shares are consistent with the committed polynomial, preventing share manipulation?

[File: src/common.rs] [Interaction: Nonce -> Binding Value] [Critical - Binding Completeness] Are nonces properly bound to the message and all other protocol parameters to prevent signature malleability?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: Nonce::gen()] [High - Hash Function Security] Is Sha256 quantum-resistant enough for nonce generation, or should post-quantum hash functions be considered?
[File: src/common.rs] [Function: TupleProof::challenge()] [Medium - Hash Prefix] Is the 'TUPLE_PROOF/' prefix sufficient, or should it include version numbers or additional context?
